intro: Hieracium crassipedipilum, commonly known as the broad-lobed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate with serrated margins. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, often blooming from June to August. Hieracium crassipedipilum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
